title: Nio, Alibaba, Bilibili among China stocks set for another rally as Covid controls ease; China is easing some COVID-19 restrictions
text:
See: China begins easing restrictions in Beijing and elsewhere

Hopes for the reopening of the country's economy helped send Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.'s U.S.-listed shares BABA to their biggest monthly gain in seven years during November, while the Golden Dragon China ETF PGJ enjoyed its largest monthly bump since September 2007.

Among the big premarket gainers Monday are U.S.-listed shares of Bilibili Inc. BILI, up 16.8%, iQiyi Inc. IQ, up 8.7%, Huya Inc. HUYA, up 6.1%, and Baidu Inc. BIDU, up 4.9%. American depositary shares of Alibaba and JD.com Inc. JD are each up 4.8%.

U.S.-listed shares of Chinese electric-vehicle companies joined in Monday's sharp premarket rally, with Nio Inc. NIO up 8.0%, XPeng Inc. XPEV up 14.9%, and Li Auto Inc. LI up 5.6%.

A relaxation of China's COVID-19 rules could benefit U.S. companies as well. Apple Inc., for one, has warned that production disruptions in China could impact iPhone 14 Pro shipments for the current quarter, and analysts are wondering how that dynamic will play out during the critical holiday selling season, and into next year.

Read:Foxconn COVID-hit plant back at full production in late December or early January, report says

The Wall Street Journal reported over the weekend that Apple "has accelerated plans" to move some of its production outside China, to India and Vietnam.

"The shift out of China will not be easy and [will] come with clear logistical, engineering, and infrastructure hurdles," Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives wrote in a Sunday note to clients.

Nio, Alibaba, Bilibili among China stocks set for another rally as Covid controls ease
